question: 非常口
sourceMnemonic: You know how <ja>非常</ja> means <kanji>emergency</kanji> and how <ja>口</ja> can be some kind of doorway (like in <ja>入り口</ja>, for example)? Well, if that's the case, then you have an emergency doorway. Usually you run away from emergencies, though, making this an <vocabulary>emergency exit</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading is the words <ja>非常</ja> and <ja>口</ja> combined together. The thing that makes this weird is that it's a mix of the kun and on'yomi readings. I guess things get all jostled up when you have yourself an emergency.
